seasons.title: The African Americans: Many Rivers to Cross

episodes.synopsis: As the earliest Africans arrived in America, the ensuing trans-Atlantic slave trade would give birth to plantation slavery in the American South.
episodes.title: The Black Atlantic (1500 - 1800)

episodes.synopsis: Black lives changed dramatically after the American Revolution. Cotton fueled the expansion of slavery, yet as slavery intensified, so did resistance.
episodes.title: The Age of Slavery (1800 - 1860)

episodes.synopsis: After the Civil War, as African Americans sought to realize the promise of freedom, the South mounted a campaign of terror to restore white supremacy.
episodes.title: Into the Fire (1861 - 1896)

episodes.synopsis: In the Jim Crow era, African Americans struggled within the confines of segregation, searching for better opportunities in the North and the West.
episodes.title: Making a Way Out of No Way (1897 - 1940)

episodes.synopsis: Inspired by Rosa Parks and Martin Luther King Jr., masses of African Americans practiced a nonviolent approach to integrate public schools and more.
episodes.title: Rise! (1940 - 1968)

episodes.synopsis: African Americans set out for a bright future after the civil rights movement's successes, but class disparity threatened to divide the community.
episodes.title: A More Perfect Union (1968 - 2013)

video.title: African Americans: Many Rivers to Cross
video.synopsis: Harvard scholar Henry Louis Gates Jr. recounts African-American history in full, exploring a range of cultural, religious and social perspectives.
